questions.text: What is the number for the room that Jerry, Elaine, and George are within in the beginning of the episode?
questions.explanation:
1397.

	Jerry, Elaine, and George are visiting their friend whose wife just had a baby.  As the mother is breast feeding, George brags about the perfect parking spot he has while the rest of them wonder where Kramer is.  Kramer is on a different floor, looking for the wrong room.

questions.text: What is the name of the baby featured in the episode?
questions.explanation:
Steven.

	While Kramer finds the 'Pigman', Jerry and Elaine are asked to be the godparents of Steven.  When Kramer comes in and rants about the half-pig, half-man beast, Elaine and Jerry try to figure out what is involved in being godparents.  They are told that they have to help with the bris.

questions.text: Who is asked to find a mohel in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Elaine.

	As one of her duties as godmother, Elaine is chosen to find the mohel for the bris.  She attempts to look up mohels in the phone book, but she doesn't find any, so she heads out to find one.  Jerry complains about holding the baby during the circumcision.

questions.text: Where does Kramer find the Pig-Man?
questions.explanation:
At the hospital.

	While searching for the room, Kramer accidentally stumbles into the room of the pig-man.  He searches for evidence and comes up with a newspaper article about DNA studies to prove his point.  Later, he takes Jerry to prove that there's a pig-man, but they don't find him.

questions.text: After a man lands on the roof of George's car after jumping off of the hospital roof, George goes to the hospital to see if they'll pay for the damages.  Do they pay for his car?
questions.explanation:
No.

	George tries to charm the hospital administrator for a brief moment, but she doesn't give and and she doesn't pay the fees.  Before even heading to the hospital, Jerry told George that it was a lost cause.  The hospital administrator feels that the mental trauma suffered by many people and the death of one patient is much more important that George's profiting from the event.

questions.text: The mohel is late for the bris.
questions.explanation:
True.

	At the bris, while everyone is waiting for the mohel to arrive, Elaine and Jerry begin to think that the parents of the baby are moving their friendship too far ahead and just taking advantage of them.  Meanwhile, Kramer is talking to the mother of the baby about the child's first memories.

questions.text: At the bris, George is talking to a woman.  What is her profession?
questions.explanation:
Cardiologist.

	George opens is conversation with 'Have you ever been to a bris before?', and when she says no, he tries to continue the conversation.  He says that if she's woozy, he can always come to him for support, but she manages to escape the conversation.

questions.text: Whose finger is cut by the mohel?
questions.explanation:
Jerry's.

	When the mohel arrives, it's apparent that Elaine chose the wrong mohel for the job.  Since it was Jerry's job to hold the baby while it was getting circumcised, the mohel accidentally slipped and cut a piece of Jerry's finger off.

George.

	Although George originally offered to console someone who may or may not have been woozy during the circumcision, George ended up fainting moments before anything happened.  After this, he rushes the gang to the hospital in his ruined car since Jerry's finger was cut.

questions.text: In the end, who is made the godfather?
questions.explanation:
Kramer.

	In the end, Jerry and Elaine have their godparent positions taken away, and George's car gets stolen from the pig-man who Kramer helped to free from the hospital.  It wasn't actually a pig-man.  Kramer says that it was actually a fat mental patient.
